required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Cognitive Functioning of Young Athletes Including Bioelectrical Brain Function
clinical_study.official_title: The Cognitive Functioning of Young Athletes (10-12 Years Old) Undertaking Various Sports Activities (Gymnastics, Football) Including Bioelectrical Brain Function

primary_outcome.description: - PU1 Battery (Borkowska, SajewiczRadtke, Lipowska, Kalka, 2016) - attention (the ability to orientate on stimulus, motor speed, maintain attention on the visual stimulus, distinguishing significant and non-significant material). Higher score means better attention.
- EEG Biofeedback - bioelectric recording of brain activity from a centrally placed electrode to measure fast brainwaves (Alpha, Beta1, Beta2) and slow brainwaves (Delta, Theta)

primary_outcome.measure: Short-term memory of verbal material material
primary_outcome.description: - PU1 Battery (Borkowska, SajewiczRadtke, Lipowska, Kalka, 2016). Higher score means better short-term memory of verbal material
- PU1 Battery (Borkowska, SajewiczRadtke, Lipowska, Kalka, 2016). Higher score means better visual-spatial material.
- PU1 Battery (Borkowska, SajewiczRadtke, Lipowska, Kalka, 2016). Higher score means better executive functions.
- PU1 Battery (Borkowska, SajewiczRadtke, Lipowska, Kalka, 2016). Higher score means better language functions.

- Diagnosis of Brain Injury (DUM) (Weidlich, Lamberti, 1996) [assessment of episodic memory of visual-spatial material (the rate of acquiring new information, the process of consolidation - the ability to transfer information from short-term to long-term memory)]. Higher score means better episodic memory of visual-spatial material (maximal points: 54, minimal: 0).

secondary_outcome.measure: Sports Intensity by International Physical Activity Questionnaire (in a modified version, relating to children) (Biernat, 2007)
secondary_outcome.description: Higher scores mean a better physical activity. In test there are 3 categories of activity: insufficient (less than 600), sufficient (600 - 1500 or 600 - 3000) or high (more than 1500 or 3000 MET-min / week)

secondary_outcome.measure: Intelligence by CFT 20-R, The Culture Fair Intelligence Test (CFIT) - version 2, part 1 only (Cattell, Weiss, adapt. Stańczak,2013)
secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of fluid intelligence. Higher score means higher fluid intelligence (maximum number of points: 56, minimal: 0).

secondary_outcome.measure: Temperament by EAS Buss & Plomin Questionnaire (Buss, Plomin, 1997)
secondary_outcome.description: A questionnaire for parents, coaches, teachers. It consists of 20 items - statements, which suitableness is rated by the subject on a five-point scale (from "Never true" to "Always true"). This version has four scales: Shyness, Sociability, Activity, and Emotionality and has 20 items relating to each of the 4 temperaments. There is a 5-point rating scale (from 1: "not characteristic or typical of your child" to 5 : "very characteristic or typical of your child"). These scores belong to each temperament and they are summed.

arm_group.description: Children in late childhood (age 10-12 years) practicing sport, which is high dynamic (> 75%), and low static (<10&) and in the same time it is open skill exercise sport (football)
Children in late childhood (age 10-12 years) practicing sport, which is low dynamic (<50%), high static (>30%) and in the same time it is closed skill exercise sport (sport gymnastics)
A comparative group of children that do not attend sport classes or sports clubs, but carrying out sports activity and / or in other areas

study_pop.textblock:
The participants will be recruited for research via Szkoły Mistrzostwa Sportowego [Sports Championship Schools] (criterion groups), sports clubs, as well as by establishing contact with other primary schools. Selecting 40 - 45 people aged 10-12 for each of the 2 control groups differentiated by the dynamic, static factor and nature of the sport close / open skill and for the comparative group of 40-45 children who are cognitively stimulated through physical activity and / or otherwise.
They will be enrolled to the study after giving their and their parents written consent to participate in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Polish-speaking children
Exclusion Criteria:
- mental illness;
- non-Polish speaking children
